page.title: 12Mannington Sub Station
page.content: Electricity is not always made in the same part of the country where it is used.To move the electricity from where it is made to where it is used, involves a system of over head power cables carried on pylons linking together with power stations & sub stations on what is often called the Super grid system. The flow of electricity on the super grid system which feeds the main sub stations of which Mannington is one needs to be at a high voltage in order to move large amounts of electricity quickly. This need for a high volume of electricity can be viewed like a river the more channels which are at the river taking the river away the greater the volume of water that will be required. As with electricity the load at the end of the cable as to be
